qas.question: In 1989, what did the Pentagon plan to reduce the army end strength to?
Which country did Iraq invade in 1990?
How many troops were involved in Operation Desert Storm?
How long did Operation Desert Storm last?
What did the Pentagon pan to increase the army strength to?
What state did Iraq invade in 1990?
How many months did Operation Desert Storm last?
How many Canadian-led troops were deployed?

context: By 1989 Germany was nearing reunification and the Cold War was coming to a close. Army leadership reacted by starting to plan for a reduction in strength. By November 1989 Pentagon briefers were laying out plans to reduce army end strength by 23%, from 750,000 to <a0_0><b5_0>580,000<b5_0/><a0_0/>. A number of incentives such as early retirement were used. In 1990 Iraq invaded its smaller neighbor, <a1_0><b6_0>Kuwait<b6_0/><a1_0/>, and U.S. land forces, quickly deployed to assure the protection of Saudi Arabia. In January 1991 <b7_0>Operation <a2_0>Desert Storm<b7_0/><a2_0/> commenced, a U.S.-led coalition which deployed over <a3_0><b9_0>500,000<a3_0/> troops<b9_0/>, the bulk of them from U.S. Army formations, to drive out Iraqi forces. The campaign ended in total victory, as Western coalition forces routed the Iraqi Army, organized along Soviet lines, in just <a4_0><b8_0>one hundred hours<a4_0/>.
